name: Kingdom of Angels
background:
The Kingdom of Angels is a faction made up mostly of Humans in the service of powerful angelic creatures. Their zealous infantry are protected by divine magic and supported by Angels who exude powerful auras over the battlefield. 

When the Great Rift opened, the people of this Kingdom were spared from destruction by the coming of the Angels. The Angels brought the people to safety beyond Tyria and taught them to worship new Twin Gods. Now they have returned to Tyria under the watchful eyes of the Angels, who offer their protection in exchange for total obedience.
backgroundFull:
When the Great Rift opened, its consequences were felt throughout Tyria. However, in one remote province along the southern border of the Empire, these consequences were particularly severe. The people of this province faced a series of catastrophes, as floods, hail, and wild fires raged throughout the region, destroying homes and crops, while the Rift cut them off from much of the Empire and their neighbours. 

It was in this time of catastrophe that the Angels revealed themselves. They presented themselves to the people and offered to take those who would follow them to a city in the sky, far from the destruction, so that they might return to rebuild in harmony with the Angels. The people came to know their new home as the Celestial City and they soon came to worship the Twin Gods of the Angels and obey their will as it was told to them by the Angels. They worked to improve their new city, their hands always guided by the watchful eyes of their angelic saviours. The youths were taught to view the Angels as saviours and protectors, and to trust in the words of their new guardians completely. After nearly two generations away, the Angel finally returned to Tyria with their followers. 

The people found their old homes abandoned and ruined, and the Angels instructed them to destroy what little remained, and sever any connections with their ancestorsâ€™ lives. Under the close supervision of the Angels, the people began to raise new temples and homes in the style of the Celestial City. These cities would serve as the core of their new realm in Tyria, and soon the Angels were ready to expand their flock. 

The Angels and their armies took to converting those who had come to the land in their absence. They offered rewards and favour to those who showed devotion and adopted the faith willingly, while crushing anyone who rebelled against them. Soon, the Angelic Kingdom began to look beyond its old provincial boundaries, seeking out strange magical relics and converting new followers, whether through preaching or conquest. They keep a close eye over their people, inspiring them forever towards greater faith in return for their salvation. 

While their followers profess the benevolence of their Angelic leaders, others in Tyria view the close supervision and strict commands of the Angels with suspicion, and some have begun to speculate that the Angels are working towards some secret ends beyond the knowledge of their followers. 

How will you spread the new faith?

gains.name: Lion
gains.label: Lion (Heavy Claws (A3, AP(1)), Fast, Fear(1), Tough(3))

spells.name: Heavenly Guidance
spells.effect: Pick up to two friendly units within 12", which get Flying once (next time the effect would apply).

parameters.name: effectDuration
parameters.value: once (next time the effect would apply)

costFormula.value: { name: params.effect.unitRule.name, rating: params.effect.unitRule.rating, multiplier: params.multiplier * (params.aura ? this.AuraSize : 1), avgUnit: !params.thisUnit }

effectDuration.name: once (next time the effect would apply)

spells.name: Lightning Bolt
spells.effect: Pick one enemy unit within 6", which takes 1 hit with AP(2) and Chop.

spells.name: Star Blessing
spells.effect: Pick up to four friendly units within 12", which get Angelic Blessing Boost once (next time the effect would apply).

parameters.name: effectDuration
parameters.value: once (next time the effect would apply)

effectDuration.name: once (next time the effect would apply)

spells.name: Angelic Storm
spells.effect: Pick up to four enemy units within 12", which take 1 hit with AP(2) each.

spells.name: Shock Energy
spells.effect: Pick up to six enemy units within 18", which friendly units gets Slayer against once (next time the effect would apply).

parameters.name: effectDuration
parameters.value: once (next time the effect would apply)

costFormula.value: { name: params.effect.unitRule.name, rating: params.effect.unitRule.rating, multiplier: params.multiplier * (this._skirmish ? 1 : this.AuraSize), avgUnit: true }

effectDuration.name: once (next time the effect would apply)

spells.name: Thunder Strike
spells.effect: Pick up to three enemy units within 18", which take 2 hits each.

specialRules.name: Deathstrike
specialRules.description: If this model is killed in melee, the attacking unit takes X hits.

specialRules.name: Sergeant
specialRules.description: When this model attacks, unmodified results of 6 to hit deal 1 extra hit (only the original hit counts as a 6 for special rules).

specialRules.name: Angelic Blessing
specialRules.description: When a unit where all models have this rule takes wounds, roll one die for each. On a 6+ it is ignored. If the wounds were from a spell, then they are ignored on a 4+ instead.

specialRules.name: Spell Conduit
specialRules.description: Casters within 12" that are from other friendly units may cast spells as if they were in this model's position, and get +1 to casting rolls when doing so.

specialRules.name: Crossing Strike
specialRules.description: Once per game, once during its activation when this model moves through enemy units, pick one of them, and roll X dice. For each 4+ it takes 3 hits with AP(1).

specialRules.name: No Retreat Aura
specialRules.description: This model and up to 3 friendly units picked before the start of the game get No Retreat. If this model is killed, picked models that are deployed lose the rule.

specialRules.name: Shred
specialRules.description: On unmodified results of 1 to block hits, this weapon deals 1 extra wound.

specialRules.name: Piercing Hunter Aura
specialRules.description: This model and up to 3 friendly units picked before the start of the game get Piercing Hunter. If this model is killed, picked models that are deployed lose the rule.

specialRules.name: Furious Aura
specialRules.description: This model and up to 3 friendly units picked before the start of the game get Furious. If this model is killed, picked models that are deployed lose the rule.

specialRules.name: Fortified Aura
specialRules.description: This model and up to 3 friendly units picked before the start of the game get Fortified. If this model is killed, picked models that are deployed lose the rule.

specialRules.name: Precision Debuff
specialRules.description: Once per activation, before attacking, pick up to 4 enemy units within 18", which gets -1 to hit rolls when attacking once (next time the effect would apply).

specialRules.name: Chop
specialRules.description: Ignores Regeneration, and against non-Hero units with Tough(3) or more, this weapon gets Deadly(+3).

specialRules.name: Slayer Mark
specialRules.description: Once per activation, before attacking, pick up to 4 enemy units within 18", which friendly units gets Slayer against once (next time the effect would apply).

specialRules.name: Angelic Blessing Boost Buff
specialRules.description: Once per activation, before attacking, pick up to 4 friendly units within 12", which gets Angelic Blessing Boost once (next time the effect would apply).

specialRules.name: Versatile Attack Buff
specialRules.description: Once per activation, before attacking, pick up to 4 friendly units within 12", which gets Versatile Attack once (next time the effect would apply).

specialRules.name: Caster
specialRules.description: Gets X spell tokens at the start of each round, but canâ€™t hold more than 6 tokens at once. At any point before attacking, spend as many tokens as the spellâ€™s value to try casting one or more spells (only one try per spell). Roll one die, on 4+ resolve the effect on a target in line of sight. Models within 18â€ in line of sight of the casterâ€™s unit may spend any number of spell tokens at the same time before rolling, to give the caster +1/-1 to the roll per token.

specialRules.name: AP
specialRules.description: Targets get -X to Defense rolls when blocking hits.

specialRules.name: No Retreat
specialRules.description: Whenever a unit where most models have this rule fails a morale test that causes it to be Shaken or Routed, the test counts as passed instead. Then, roll as many dice as the number of wounds it would take to check for wound effects (must always roll at least 1 die), and for each result of 1-3 the unit takes one wound, which can't be ignored.

specialRules.name: Piercing Hunter
specialRules.description: When this model shoots at enemies over 9" away, its weapons get AP(+1).

specialRules.name: Furious
specialRules.description: When charging, unmodified results of 6 to hit in melee deal 1 extra hit (only the original hit counts as a 6 for special rules).

specialRules.name: Fortified
specialRules.description: When units where all models have this rule take hits, those hits count as having AP(-1), to a min. of AP(0).

specialRules.name: Deadly
specialRules.description: Assign each wound to one model, and multiply it by X. Hits from Deadly must be resolved first, and these wounds donâ€™t carry over to other models if the original target is killed.

specialRules.name: Regeneration
specialRules.description: When a unit where all models have this rule takes wounds, roll one die for each. On a 5+ it is ignored.

specialRules.name: Ignores Regeneration
specialRules.description: This weapon ignores Regeneration.

specialRules.name: Tough
specialRules.description: This model only rolls to check wound effects once it has taken at least X wounds, and is only Knocked Out on rolls of 5+X or more.

specialRules.name: Slayer
specialRules.description: This model's weapons get AP(+2) against units where most models have Tough(3) or higher.

specialRules.name: Angelic Blessing Boost
specialRules.description: If all models in this unit have Angelic Blessing, they ignore non-spell wounds on rolls of 5-6 from Angelic Blessing (instead of only on 6+).

specialRules.name: Versatile Attack
specialRules.description: When this unit is activated, pick one effect: until the end of the activation all models with this rule in it either get AP(+1) when attacking, or get +1 to hit rolls when attacking.

specialRules.name: Flying
specialRules.description: May move through units and terrain, and ignores terrain effects whilst moving, and automatically passes jumping rolls.
